channel.title: Is it possible to route my SSH server traffic via Whonix-Gateway?
channel.description:
Is it possible to route my SSH server traffic via Whonix-Gateway?
I have machines that connect to my SSH server (via PUTTY). I want the SSH traffic going to the Internet to be routed over TOR (non SSH traffic will go through normal ISP). Is there some SSH configuration to do this?

item.title: Is it possible to route my SSH server traffic via Whonix-Gateway?
item.dc:creator: 0brand
item.description:
How do I use Whonix-Gateway as a gateway?

Hi jslk39s

You first have to understand how to use SSH socks5 . Try configuring/testing in a Debian VM. Then move on the Whonix. Keep in mind there is no step 1 step 2 … step 20. - finished! Much of it you will have to figure out by researching, experimenting on your own. There are also links in the Tunnels Introduction that might be helpful so be sure to read through all of it.

Whonix

Tunnels/Introduction

Instructions on how to combine tunnels (VPN, SSH, proxy) with Tor. (User -> Tor -> proxy/VPN/SSH -> Internet) (User -> proxy/VPN/SSH ->…

Whonix

Tunnels/Connecting to SSH before Tor

Instructions on how to connect to SSH before Tor (User -> SSH -> Tor -> Internet)

You can also use the forum search engine (upper right hand corner or your screen). Look for other users that have asked similar questions. Key words SSH, putty etc.

Read full topic
item.source: Is it possible to route my SSH server traffic via Whonix-Gateway?
